intro: Dodecatheon watsonii, commonly known as the Watson's glory-of-the-snow, is a herbaceous perennial native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Primulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and features lance-shaped leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers range in color from white to pink and are often borne in clusters at the base of the plant. Dodecatheon watsonii thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
